about.para: I'm an experienced software engineer, where I have specialized in developing and maintain the Store Platform at Gilt, using technologies such as Scala, Handlebars, Backbone, Node.js, LESS, CSS, jQuery and Javascript.
I've also have had vast experience in writing test automation using a combination of Java, Python, WebDriver API, Scala and custom frameworks based around TestNG and JUnit.
I've experience leading projects and managing releases, as well as managing offshore QA engineers. I've worked within Agile and Waterfall development cycles.

I'm extremely passionate about quality and ensuring that the user receives the best possible experience when using software that we provide them; I look at things from a user's point of view to help deliver on this.

I've spent the last number of years working in quality and development roles to enable me to build a fundamental understanding of web practices and web technologies such as JavaScript. This learning has also enabled me to identify complex problems and solve this with creative solutions. I've created a lot of security patches to Gilt.com to ensure user safety.
I've experience leading multiple projects at once such as the engineering effort of Microsoft Office for Mac 2008 SP2 and the release of the monthly patch release of Microsoft Office 2004.

education.fyProject: Dynamic Web Pages - I created a RSS web system using PHP and MySQL to allow lecturers and student interactive on important course information like lecture changes, assignment date changes etc.
Inventory Tracking System - I created an inventory system using ASP and SQL to allow companies keep track of hardware, software and allow management to create reports on inventory levels.

tasks.item: Implemented an automation framework to test the Sohalo API’s on a daily basis in Jenkins.
Expanded (planned and implemented) the aforementioned framework to run Selenium tests.
Integrated the php-webdriver bindings to replace the PHPUnit Selenium Extension, which contains better functionality and more flexibility.
Currently in the planning phase of implementing Test-Driven Development in the Software Development Life Cycle.
Was owner of the WebQA Wiki Test suite.
Restructured the wiki project to match other WebQA project structures.
Develop automated tests for the WebQA Wiki site, https://github.com/mozilla/wiki-tests/.
Update and review documentation on the Mozilla QMO site.
Planning and implementing new ways to drive traffic through the different stores applications on Gilt.com.
Implementing end-to-end features on Gilt.com such as the Shop By Age widget on the Kids store front.
Develop and maintain the existing store platform.
Automated testing of the store platform in the form of unit tests or front-end selenium tests.
Drove the automation pass rate from ~60% on 1 environment to over 90% across 3 environments (Local, Grid & Sauce).
Investigate and fix any automation failures for the Business Operations project using innovative solutions. I recently implemented a new way to test our web services.
Manage the Business Operations project releases on a bi-weekly basis, which involves managing off-site QA engineers.
Assist team members with automation queries and best practices. I’m also a Mentor in the Gilt Mentoring program.
Continued development of automated tests for the Business Operations team, which required very quick turnaround.
